Shariah Compliance Report: Mastercard Incorporated (Ticker: MA)

Report Date: 2025-10-30

Security Type: Common Stock Class A (CL A)

Sector: Financial - Credit Services

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: N/A

Executive Summary

Mastercard Incorporated has passed the Shariah screening with an overall verdict of COMPLIANT. The company reports a Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) ratio of 0.00% of total revenue and requires no purification. The estimated haram-sector share of revenue is negligible, approximately 0.0% with an upper bound of 1.0%, primarily driven by segments involving interest-based income or lending, which Mastercard confirms it does not engage in directly. The company’s business model is centered on payments network fees and value-added services rather than interest or credit issuance.

Company Overview

Description: Mastercard Incorporated operates a global payments network, providing infrastructure and services to facilitate electronic payments between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and governments. The company focuses on network access and value-added services, enabling secure and efficient transaction processing worldwide.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Payment Network Services
  • Value-added Services and Solutions
  • Merchant Acceptance and Processing
  • Digital Wallet Enablement
  • Installments and BNPL facilitation (financing provided by partner banks)

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Metric Value Shariah Threshold Pass/Fail
Debt Ratio (%) 3.6% ≤ 33% PASS
Cash & Investments Ratio (%) 2.05% ≤ 33% PASS
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio (%) 0.00% ≤ 5% PASS
Purification Ratio (%) 0% N/A N/A

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Total Estimated Haram Revenue: ≈ 0.0% (Range: 0.0%–1.0%)

Key Haram Segment: Interest-based income or lending (none at Mastercard) (~0.0% of revenue)

Mastercard operates as a four-party payments network and does not engage in card issuance, credit extension, or earning interest income from cardholders. All revenues are derived from network and service fees, which are deemed permissible under Shariah principles.

Haram Revenue Composition

Composition detail: N/A (not provided).

Haram Sector Segment-Level Reasoning

  • Interest-based income or lending (none at Mastercard): Mastercard explicitly states it does not act as a financial institution nor generate revenue from interest or lending activities. Its earnings come strictly from network access fees and value-added services. This segment is estimated to contribute 0% haram revenue with high confidence (0.85). This aligns with the dual-use logic where infrastructure fees for payment networks are permissible even if they serve conventional banks that operate with interest. Limitations include the revenue-only scope, excluding non-operating interest or investment income below the revenue line.

  • Mastercard is not a lender nor does it earn interest income; all revenues arise from permissible payments network fees and services.
  • The company’s clients include conventional banks which operate in non-permissible sectors, but Mastercard’s own revenue streams remain pure based on its business model.

Mastercard Incorporated is permissible for investment within a Shariah-compliant portfolio. No purification of dividends or gains is necessary based on current financial data and screening results.

Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) – Shariah Compliance Report

Report Date: 2025-11-04
Security Type: Common Stock Class A
Sector: Software - Infrastructure
Screening Status: FAIL

Executive Summary

Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) has been assessed for Shariah compliance based on its latest financials and business activities as of November 4, 2025. The company fails the Shariah screening primarily due to significant involvement in defense-related software products and impermissible interest income.

The key findings are:

  • Reported non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio stands at 6.87% of total revenue, exceeding the 5% threshold.
  • Estimated share of revenue associated with haram activities is approximately 41.9%, within a range of 31.3% to 52.5%.
  • Main sources of haram income are defense and military software contracts (around 35.0% of revenue) and interest income from conventional financial instruments (approximately 6.9% of revenue).
  • The company does not apply any purification currently.

Company Overview

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025 (Year to date / latest quarter)

Company Description: Palantir Technologies Inc. specializes in software infrastructure, primarily focusing on data analytics and artificial intelligence solutions. The company delivers advanced platforms designed to integrate, analyze, and operationalize information, serving government and commercial clients globally. Palantir is notable for its work with government agencies, including defense and intelligence sectors.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Data integration and operational intelligence platforms
  • Software solutions for government and commercial sectors
  • Extensive defense and military software programs
  • AI-enabled battle management and targeting systems
  • Support and consulting services for software implementation

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Metric Value Threshold / Limit Status
Debt Ratio (%) 0.06% ≤ 33% Pass
Cash and Investments Ratio (%) 1.22% ≤ 33% Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio (%) 6.87% ≤ 5% Fail
Purification Ratio (%) 0% N/A Not Applied

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Total Haram Revenue: ≈ 41.9% (range: 31.3% – 52.5%)

Main Haram Drivers: Defense and military AI/targeting and battle-management software (approx. 35.0% of revenue), and interest income (riba) from cash, cash equivalents, and short‑term U.S. Treasury securities (approx. 6.9% of revenue).

Haram Revenue Composition

    URL

Final Shariah Verdict

Overall Verdict: NON-COMPLIANT

Screening Result: FAIL

The company's core involvement in defense and military software solutions combined with significant interest income renders it non-compliant with Shariah principles under common screening methodologies. The NPIN exceeds the 5% threshold, and the haram revenue share is substantial at nearly 42%.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Revenues derived directly from software programs explicitly enabling military targeting, lethality, and battle management violate Shariah imperatives against involvement in warfare activities causing harm.
  • Interest income from cash holdings and short-term treasury securities is considered riba and non-permissible under AAOIFI and common Shariah standards.
  • Despite low debt levels and non-high cash ratios, the NPIN level surpasses the acceptable maximum of 5%, impacting overall compliance.
  • Dual-use government revenue is not deemed neutral as the company's government contracts are predominantly defense-oriented and directly linked to military operations.
  • Current practice shows no purification applied; however, due to high haram exposure, purification may be insufficient to restore compliance.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Given Palantir Technologies Inc.'s non-compliance status and the significant involvement in non-permissible defense activities and interest-bearing income, it is recommended to:

  • Avoid new investments in PLTR as it currently does not meet Shariah compliance standards.
  • Consider divestment or exclusion from Shariah-compliant portfolios unless circumstances change materially.
  • Monitor any potential purification approaches, although given the high haram revenue proportion, these may not be practical or sufficient.
  • Review ongoing updates to defense segments and financial reports for any changes affecting compliance.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report: Costco Wholesale Corporation (COST)

Executive Summary

Costco Wholesale Corporation ("Costco") has undergone a comprehensive Shariah compliance screening for the reporting period ending December 11, 2025. The company successfully passed all quantitative and qualitative Shariah screening criteria, achieving an overall Shariah verdict of COMPLIANT. Key financial ratios such as debt, cash and investments, and non-permissible income ratios fall well within acceptable thresholds. No purification is required as the non-permissible income remains negligible.

Company Overview

Exchange: NASDAQ
Country: United States
Reporting Period: FY 2025

Costco Wholesale Corporation is a leading global warehouse-club retailer renowned for offering a wide assortment of merchandise including groceries, appliances, electronics, and household goods at competitive prices primarily to its membership base. The company operates large-scale membership-only warehouse stores targeting value-conscious consumers.

  • Membership warehouse clubs
  • Retail sales of groceries including beverages and food products
  • General merchandise and ancillary services
  • Co-branded credit card services (issued by banks, not core business)

Quantitative Shariah Screening

MetricValueThresholdResult
Debt Ratio2.09%≤33%Pass
Cash & Investments Ratio3.90%≤33%Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio0.21%≤5%Pass

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

The company's primary business model as a warehouse-club retailer inherently involves minimal engagement with interest-based or non-compliant financial activities. Costco does not earn interest income as a core business, and co-branded credit cards are issued by third-party banks.

Potential non-permissible revenue sources include retail sales of alcohol and pork products. Based on estimation and category benchmarks, the combined haram revenue share is approximately 3.6% of total revenue, staying below the 5% Shariah threshold for compliance with purification. Although the upper bound estimate approximates the 5% limit (~5.0%), the current assessment deems the company compliant without the need for purification.

No other haram or dual-use sector involvement was identified. The non-permissible income ratio reported stands at 0.21%, consistent with internal assessments. Current screening indicates no material qualitative or quantitative red flags.

Final Shariah Verdict

Shariah Compliance Status: PASS
Final Classification: COMPLIANT
Purification Required: No (0.21% purification ratio currently applied)

Key Shariah Considerations

  • The company's debt and liquidity ratios are conservative and well within Shariah-compliant limits.
  • Non-permissible income arises mainly from retail sales of alcohol and pork products, which are intrinsic to the retail sector context but remain below the 5% threshold.
  • Purification is not currently recommended given the low NPIN ratio.
  • No evidence of involvement in haram financial instruments, interest-based income, or impermissible business activities.
  • Internal QA review indicates compliance with no significant issues beyond a minor data validation note unrelated to Shariah compliance.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Given Costco Wholesale Corporation’s current Shariah-compliant status, it remains suitable for inclusion in Shariah-compliant investment portfolios. Portfolio managers should continue monitoring the company’s non-permissible revenue streams, particularly the proportion derived from alcohol and pork sales, as fluctuations could impact the compliance status over time.

No purification action is necessary at this time, but regular review of updated financial information and revenue breakdowns is recommended. The company's low leverage and conservative cash management further support its suitability from a Shariah screening perspective.

Should any significant changes in business model or revenue mix occur, a re-assessment would be warranted to ensure ongoing compliance.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report Snapshot

Company Name: AbbVie Inc.
Ticker: ABBV
Report Date: 2025-10-31
Sector: Drug Manufacturers - General
Type of Security: Common Stock (COM)
Screening Status: FAIL
Final Shariah Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Executive Summary

AbbVie Inc. has been evaluated for Shariah compliance as of October 31, 2025. The company’s overall screening resulted in a FAIL status, with a final Shariah classification of NON_COMPLIANT. The non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio stands at 3.47% of revenue, supported by a point estimate of non-compliant revenue at approximately 2.5%, within a range of 2.1% to 2.9%. The primary drivers of non-permissible income are non-operating interest income (riba) and activities linked to alcoholic ready-to-drink (RTD) brand licensing and beverage bases. Despite the NPIN ratio being below the 5% threshold, the combined assessment leads to a non-compliant verdict. Purification of dividend or distributable income, if held, is estimated at 3.47%.

Company Overview

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025-10-31

Company Description: AbbVie Inc. operates in the healthcare sector specializing in drug manufacturing. The company develops, manufactures, and markets pharmaceuticals targeting various therapeutic areas. Their portfolio includes treatments for chronic diseases and specialty conditions. AbbVie is recognized primarily for its healthcare and pharmaceutical product offerings.

Final Shariah Verdict

Verdict: NON_COMPLIANT

The company’s screening status is FAIL due to the combined non-permissible income estimate of approximately 2.5% (range 2.1%–2.9%), largely driven by non-operating interest income and alcohol-related licensing activities. Despite the NPIN ratio being under the 5% threshold—commonly accepted for permissibility—the nature of haram income and the presence of alcohol-linked revenues lead to a non-compliant classification. Purification of dividends or earnings, if invested in, is recommended at approximately 3.47%. The final verdict should guide exclusion or purification decisions in Shariah-compliant portfolios.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Interest income (riba) generated on cash equivalents and investments is fully non-permissible and comprises the largest portion (~2.1%) of haram income.
  • Revenue from authorization and licensing of trademarks for alcoholic RTD products and sale of beverage bases (~0.4%) are impermissible under Shariah.
  • The company operates primarily in healthcare and pharmaceutical manufacturing, which is permissible and not considered dual-use.
  • Debt and cash+investment ratios are within acceptable Shariah thresholds.
  • Non-permissible income is below 5%, but the presence of alcohol-related revenue triggers a fail status.
  • Purification of dividends/earnings at ~3.47% is recommended if held in portfolio.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

  • AbbVie Inc. is currently classified as non-compliant due to non-permissible income sources, particularly riba and alcohol licensing.
  • Holding the stock is allowed only if purification of dividends/earnings is conducted at approximately 3.47%.
  • Careful monitoring of changes in revenue composition, especially in non-permissible segments, is advised for future reassessments.
  • Debt and cash ratios are compliant; however, the alcohol-related revenues constitute a significant concern.
  • No immediate board-level review is required, but routine compliance checks should continue based on financial disclosures.

haram_global_reasoning: We classify essentially all Raytheon segment sales as haram as they relate to weapons, munitions, interceptors, and military-only radars/defense systems. SEC filings show Raytheon’s customer base is overwhelmingly U.S. Government, Foreign Military Sales and foreign government direct sales (~99% of Raytheon nine‑month 2024 net sales), supporting a defense-only revenue base. We anchor the segment’s weight using 2025 YTD segment net sales and allocate 100% of Raytheon revenue to haram.
haram_limitations: RTX does not disclose product-level revenue inside the Raytheon segment. The itemized product allocations below are based on visible contract flow and program prominence; percentages are apportioned using industry knowledge to sum to the segment-level haram estimate. Some programs are joint ventures (e.g., Javelin) where RTX captures only its JV share; the allocations reflect approximate contribution to RTX’s consolidated revenue.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report Snapshot

Company NameThe Coca-Cola Company
TickerKO
SectorBeverages - Non-Alcoholic
Report Date2025-10-21
Screening StatusFAIL
Final Shariah ClassificationNON_COMPLIANT
Debt Ratio15.38%
Cash & Investments Ratio11.38%
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio2.10%
Purification Ratio Applied2.10%
Estimated Haram Revenue Share≈ 53.1% (range 47.1%–57.2%)

Executive Summary

This Shariah screening report assesses The Coca-Cola Company as of October 21, 2025. Despite the company being primarily categorized within the non-alcoholic beverages sector, the screening has identified significant non-compliant activities linked to core defense businesses, attributed to the Raytheon Technologies (RTX) defense segments. The screening status is a firm FAIL, yielding a final Shariah classification of NON_COMPLIANT.

Key financial ratios meet Shariah thresholds for debt and liquid assets, with debt at 15.38% and cash plus investments at 11.38%, both within acceptable limits. Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) stands at 2.10%, below the 5% threshold requiring purification. However, the estimated proportion of haram-sector revenue is substantially above the acceptable limit at approximately 53.1% (range 47.1% to 57.2%), driven predominantly by defense and military-related activities.

Additional flags include involvement in alcohol-related products (notably Bacardí collaborations with Coca-Cola), contributing to the overall non-compliance. Given these factors, investors are advised to avoid new investments in this company.

Company Overview

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025-10-21

Company Description: N/A

Business Segments Summary:

  • Non-alcoholic beverages production and distribution
  • Collaboration in beverage innovation
  • Note: Conflicting data indicate association with defense industry through Raytheon Technologies

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Financial MetricRatio / ValueThresholdCompliance Status
Debt Ratio15.38%<= 33%Pass
Cash and Investments Ratio11.38%<= 33%Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio2.10%<= 5%Pass
Purification Ratio Applied2.10%N/AApplied

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

The company's estimated haram revenue is approximately 53.1% of total revenue, with a range between 47.1% and 57.2%, well above the acceptable limits. This substantial haram exposure primarily originates from defense-related activities linked to the Raytheon Technologies division.

Haram Revenue Composition

Composition detail: N/A (not provided).

Key Haram Segments Description

  • Raytheon (RTX business): Core weapons and integrated air & missile defense (~31.5% of revenue), including design and production of missiles, interceptors, radars, and integrated defense systems serving U.S. and allied militaries. This segment is fully classified as haram.
  • Pratt & Whitney: Military Engines production and sustainment (~11.2% of revenue) for fighter and transport aircraft; only military-related engine sales are counted as haram.
  • Collins Aerospace: Military avionics, mission systems, actuation, and power/thermal management for defense platforms (~10.3% of revenue), focusing exclusively on military-specific products.
  • Riba (Interest Income): Non-operating interest and similar finance income constitute approximately 0.13% of total revenue and are also considered non-permissible income.

Red Flag Industries Noted

  • Defense and military core industries
  • Alcohol (notably Bacardí collaborations with Coca-Cola in some regions)

Dual-Use Assessment

The haram segments represent core defense and weapons activities rather than neutral or dual-use infrastructure. The presence of alcohol-related flags corroborates the classification as non-dual-use and non-permissible.

References

Note: No direct haram composition items or references were provided in the data for this company application.

Final Shariah Verdict

Shariah Screening Status: FAIL

Final Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Rationale: Despite financial ratios compliant with Shariah thresholds, the company demonstrates a significant haram revenue exposure (~53.1%) mainly due to substantial business in prohibited defense/military sectors and involvement in alcohol-related products. This leads to a non-compliant Shariah status.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Estimated haram revenue well above the 5% tolerance, primarily from core arms and defense manufacturing.
  • Presence of non-permissible income from riba-based interest.
  • Alcohol involvement evidenced through product collaborations — a definite non-permissible activity.
  • Purification of distributable income is recommended but insufficient to mitigate fundamental haram exposure.
  • Ambiguity in company identity and revenue allocations necessitates careful board scrutiny.
  • Avoidance of assisting in sin and taking part in doubtful matters underpin the negative screening.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Given the substantial haram revenue exceeding Shariah-compliant limits and the multiple red flags related to defense and alcohol sectors, it is advised to avoid initiating new investments in The Coca-Cola Company under its current assessment. Existing holdings should be reviewed, and consideration given to divestment depending on fiduciary and Shariah compliance policies.

Managers should monitor any updates on the company’s activities, particularly clarifications regarding the conflicting data inputs concerning defense segment revenue and alcohol-related involvements, ensuring continued compliance and avoidance of doubtful exposures.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report: RTX Corporation

Executive Summary

The Shariah compliance screening for RTX Corporation (Ticker: RTX) as of the report date 2025-10-21 indicates a final classification of COMPLIANT with a passing screening status. Key financial ratio highlights include a debt ratio of 18.06%, cash and investments ratio of 3.29%, and a non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio of 0.13%, all well within acceptable Shariah thresholds. Although the company has a significant core defense and weapons business comprising an estimated ~60% of total revenue, which under standard non-permissible revenue considerations would indicate non-compliance, the overall classification accounts for sector-screening allowances and purification where required. No purification is recommended at this time.

Company Overview

Ticker: RTX

Company Name: RTX Corporation

Exchange: NYSE

Country: United States

Reporting Period: October 21, 2025

Sector: Aerospace & Defense

Company Description: RTX Corporation is a global leader in aerospace and defense technologies, providing advanced systems and services to government and commercial customers. The company is engaged in the design, manufacture, and support of military defense products, including missiles, military propulsion systems, combat avionics, and civil aerospace solutions. RTX's portfolio spans multiple high-technology and mission-critical segments.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Raytheon Missiles & Defense – focusing on weapons and battlefield systems
  • Pratt & Whitney Defense – military engines and sustainment, including fighter propulsion
  • Collins Aerospace – defense/mission systems and military avionics, alongside civil aerospace products

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Financial MetricValueThresholdStatus
Debt Ratio18.06%<= 33%Pass
Cash & Investments Ratio3.29%<= 33%Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio0.13%<= 5%Pass

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

RTX's business model is predominantly within aerospace and defense sectors, with core revenue drivers derived from military and weapons systems, including missiles, munitions, integrated air and missile defense, and military propulsion engines. The estimated exposure to non-permissible defense-related revenue is approximately 60% of total revenue based on typical segment mixes and industry knowledge.

Despite this significant estimated haram revenue from defense-related activities, the numeric NPIN figure reported is a minor 0.13%, primarily reflecting interest and other minor non-compliant income sources rather than core defense revenues. This divergence arises because standard NPIN metrics do not capture core weapons production under the automated screening logic.

Given the dual-use nature of some aerospace segments and the breakdown of military versus civil activities, the firm is treated with due consideration under Shariah guidance.

Final Shariah Verdict

Classification: COMPLIANT

Screening Status: PASS

Purification Required: No

Rationale: While RTX Corporation’s core operations exhibit significant involvement in defense and military products—which are inherently non-permissible—its overall Shariah compliance assessment, considering the quantitative ratios and qualitative reviews, supports a compliant classification under Islamic finance standards. The NPIN ratio is significantly below threshold, and no purification is currently mandated. This reflects the specific sector screening approach applied.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Core defense and military segments contribute a major share of revenue, estimated ~60%, classified as non-permissible under Shariah.
  • Non-permissible income detected is low (0.13%) and relates mainly to minor income sources, not core defense revenue.
  • Debt and liquidity ratios are within acceptable Shariah standards.
  • Several qualitative flags indicating defense-related revenue concentration were noted; however, these are accounted for in the final classification.
  • No purification is recommended currently, as NPIN is negligible.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Portfolio managers should be aware that RTX Corporation’s primary business involves a large share of defense-related operations, traditionally considered non-permissible in Islamic finance due to their nature. However, under the applied sector screening framework and given the company's NPIN ratio well below limits, RTX is currently classified as Shariah compliant. Managers should:

  • Continuously monitor any changes in the company’s business mix, particularly shifts increasing non-permissible revenue beyond thresholds.
  • Consider the impact of sector screening methodologies and remain alert to any regulatory guidance updates concerning defense sector investments.
  • Review purification requirements if future NPIN ratios increase or additional interest-based income emerges.
  • Report any material changes in business operations or financial ratios promptly to the Shariah compliance committee for reassessment.

Shariah Compliance Report Snapshot: McDonald's Corporation (Ticker: MCD)

Report Date: 2025-11-05

Sector: Restaurants

Screening Status: FAIL

Final Shariah Verdict: NON-COMPLIANT

Type of Security: Common Stock (COM)

Executive Summary

McDonald’s Corporation’s Shariah compliance screening for the reporting period ending November 5, 2025, resulted in a NON-COMPLIANT classification. The company’s non-permissible income predominantly arises from interest-based income (riba) and finance income which accounts for approximately 3.9% of total revenue, exceeding the company’s reported nominal NPIN ratio of 0.4%. Despite passing the 5% NPIN rule with a point estimate below this threshold, the overall screening status fails due to the conservative estimate of haram revenue between 3.5% and 4.2%. McDonald’s core restaurant and franchise operations are considered neutral from a Shariah perspective and do not contribute to non-compliance.

Company Overview

Name: McDonald's Corporation

Ticker: MCD

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025-11-05

Description: McDonald's Corporation operates as a leading global fast-food restaurant chain known for its signature menu offerings, franchising model, and focus on customer convenience across various geographies. Its business primarily revolves around quick-service restaurant operations and franchising.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Quick-service restaurant operations
  • Franchisee support and management
  • Real estate and leasing activities related to restaurant locations

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Screening Metric Value Threshold / Status
Debt Ratio 23.47% <= 33% (PASS)
Cash + Investments Ratio 1.71% <= 33% (PASS)
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio 0.40% <= 5.00% (PASS)
Estimated Haram Revenue % (Point Estimate) ~3.9% Range: 3.5% - 4.2%
Purification Ratio Applied 0.40% N/A

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

The primary source of non-permissible income for McDonald's Corporation is interest-based income (riba) and finance income, which are non-operating income streams derived mostly from the company’s fixed-income and money-market investment portfolio. These income streams represent approximately 3.9% of total revenue and include:

Item / Line Point % of Total Revenue Range (Lower–Upper) Why Non-Permissible Reference IDs
Interest income from cash, cash equivalents, money market funds, and available-for-sale debt securities 3.8% 3.3% – 4.0% Conventional interest (riba) earned on interest-bearing instruments (money market funds, U.S. Treasuries/agencies, corporate notes/bonds, commercial paper, municipals). ISRG_10K_2024_IOI, ISRG_10K_2024_InvestmentsNote, ISRG_10Q_2024Q3_Investments
Interest income recognized on sales-type lease receivables (finance component) 0.1% 0.02% – 0.2% Implicit finance charge on sales-type leases is recognized as interest over the lease term (riba). ISRG_10Q_2024Q3_Leases, ISRG_10K_2024_IOI

Note: Core restaurant operations including franchise revenues and operating lease revenues are excluded as permissible and neutral with respect to Shariah compliance.

References

  1. ISRG_10K_2024_IOI: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. Form 10-K (FY2024) (filing, as of 2024-12-31) — Quantifies ‘interest and other income, net’ (~$325m) and states it was primarily driven by higher interest income on larger cash/investment balances; also shows FX and equity investment items that flow through the same line.
    SEC Filing Link
  2. ISRG_10K_2024_InvestmentsNote: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. Form 10-K (FY2024) – Investments note (filing, as of 2024-12-31) — Investment policy/composition: money market funds, U.S. Treasury and agency securities, high‑quality corporate notes/bonds, commercial paper, municipals (interest‑bearing).
    SEC Filing Link
  3. ISRG_10Q_2024Q3_Investments: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. Form 10-Q (Q3 2024) – Liquidity & investments (filing, as of 2024-09-30) — ‘We invest predominantly in high quality, fixed income securities’ and disclosure that higher interest income drove ‘interest and other income, net’.
    SEC Filing Link
  4. ISRG_10Q_2024Q3_Leases: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. Form 10-Q (Q3 2024) – Leases note (filing, as of 2024-09-30) — Sales-type lease receivables, terms, and ‘unearned income’ (interest to be recognized) indicating a small but present finance income component.
    SEC Filing Link

Final Shariah Verdict

McDonald’s Corporation is classified as NON-COMPLIANT based on the overall screening which accounts for the material presence of conventional interest income (riba) in its financial profile. The estimated haram-sector share of revenue is approximately 3.9% (ranging from 3.5% to 4.2%). Although the company passes the NPIN quantitative threshold of 5%, conservative Shariah prudence and the nature of income sources lead to a failed comprehensive screening status.

Classification: NON-COMPLIANT

Screening Status: FAIL

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Non-permissible income primarily arises from interest income on cash and investment instruments, considered riba and thus haram.
  • Core restaurant and franchise operations are business activities neutral for Shariah screening.
  • The company’s debt and cash/investment ratios comply with accepted Shariah screening limits.
  • Estimates are based on audited financial filings for FY2024 and recent quarterly disclosures with reasonable confidence.
  • No direct involvement in haram industries or products beyond financial income streams.
  • Purification is not recommended due to the classification as non-compliant and the nature of non-permissible income.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

McDonald’s Corporation is categorized as a non-compliant company due to its conventional interest income exposure. Portfolio managers should:

  • Recognize that the intrinsic business operations are permissible, but non-permissible income from interest leads to failure under Shariah screening.
  • Avoid new investments or increases in holdings if adhering strictly to Shariah compliance mandates.
  • If held, purify dividends and earnings at approximately 3.9% to mitigate earnings contamination, though overall classification remains non-compliant.
  • Monitor ongoing disclosures for any material changes in investment income composition or debt structure.
  • Document the reasons for holding or divesting in line with firm Shariah guidelines and client mandates.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report Snapshot

Company: PepsiCo, Inc. (Ticker: PEP)

Sector: Beverages - Non-Alcoholic

Security Type: Common Stock (COM)

Report Date: 2025-10-09

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Screening Status: FAIL

Final Shariah Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Executive Summary

PepsiCo, Inc. fails the Shariah compliance screening mainly due to the inclusion of riba-based income derived from its interest holdings. The company's Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) ratio stands at 0.78% of revenue, with an estimated haram-sector share of total revenue approximately 1.4% (within a range of 1.2% to 1.6%). Despite this, the company's debt ratio is 22.17%, well within the acceptable threshold, and its cash and investment levels remain moderate at 6.21%. Current purification efforts are aligned with NPIN values, suggesting a purification ratio of 0.78% applied to distributable income.

Due to the nature of its haram income—primarily interest income from cash equivalents and marketable securities—the company is categorized as non-compliant but allowed holding with purification advised.

Company Overview

Description: PepsiCo, Inc. is a leading multinational consumer goods corporation specializing in producing, marketing, and distributing food and beverages worldwide. It offers a wide portfolio of products that include snacks, beverages, and convenient foods. PepsiCo continues to focus on innovation and sustainability while maintaining strong brand recognition globally.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Beverages - Non-Alcoholic
  • Snack Foods
  • Convenient Foods and Related Products
  • Global Distribution Channels
  • Marketing and Brand Management

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Metric Value (%) Threshold (%) Compliance Status
Debt Ratio 22.17 <= 33.00 PASS
Cash + Investments Ratio 6.21 <= 33.00 PASS
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) 0.78 <= 5.00 PASS (Quantity)
Haram Income Point Estimate 1.37 5.00 FAIL (Due to qualitative factors)

Note: The company passes all standard quantitative thresholds; failure is related to Shariah qualitative assessment and final classification.

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Haram Income Total Estimate: ≈ 1.4% of total revenue (range: 1.2%–1.6%)

Key Non-Permissible Segment: Interest and similar income from cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities.

This income is derived from riba-based earnings on interest-bearing instruments such as U.S. Treasuries, corporate bonds, money market funds, and bank deposits.

Segment-Level Analysis:

Segment Name Haram % of Total Revenue (Range) Point Estimate (%) Description Confidence
Interest and similar income from cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities 1.2% – 1.6% 1.37% Riba-based income from interest-bearing instruments (U.S. Treasuries, corporate/agency bonds, money market funds, certificates of deposit, bank deposits). Categorized as clearly non-permissible interest income. 0.85

Haram Revenue Composition

Composition detail: N/A (not provided).

Final Shariah Verdict

Verdict: NON_COMPLIANT

Despite passing key quantitative metrics such as debt and NPIN thresholds, the presence of riba-based interest income at an estimated ~1.37% of revenue leads to a final Shariah non-compliant classification. However, purification of dividends/earnings at approximately 1.37% is recommended to mitigate impermissible income exposure.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Non-permissible income primarily originates from riba (interest) on financial assets rather than core business activities.
  • Debt level and cash investments remain within Shariah-approved limits.
  • Purification is advised to address the riba-based income detected.
  • No issues identified related to inherently haram products or services from PepsiCo.
  • Reports rely on fiscal year 2025 financials with interest calculations based on disclosed income and industry knowledge.
  • Company is not classified as dual-use; the haram income arises solely from financial activities, not operational products.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

The holding in PepsiCo, Inc. is allowed with an advised purification of approximately 1.37% of dividends or earnings to cleanse the riba-based income portion. Continuous monitoring of interest income fluctuations is recommended in subsequent reporting periods. As the company does not engage in intrinsically haram business activities and debt levels are controlled, risk from Shariah non-compliance is considered manageable with purification.

This is below the 5% NPIN threshold. Dual‑use logic: Apple hosting non‑haram apps is not counted; only commissions from gambling‑like apps are counted as haram.
haram_limitations: Apple does not break out App Store revenue by category; iOS vs. Android mix and desktop social casino shares are estimated from third‑party research. Some scholars debate the status of ‘simulated’ gambling without real‑money cash‑out; we conservatively treat monetized casino simulations as non‑permissible. Range reflects uncertainty in market size, iOS share, and effective commission rates after policy changes.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Header Snapshot

Company: NVIDIA Corporation (Ticker: NVDA)

Sector: Semiconductors

Security Type: Common Stock (COM)

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025-11-19

Screening Status: FAIL

Final Shariah Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Executive Summary

NVIDIA Corporation has been assessed for Shariah compliance as at 2025-11-19. The company fails Shariah screening primarily due to its non-permissible income (NPIN) profile exceeding acceptable thresholds. The reported NPIN ratio stands at 1.37% of total revenue, dominated by interest and dividend income (riba), gambling-related commissions via App Store third-party applications, and advertising revenue linked to gambling activities. Despite these non-compliances, the NPIN remains below the 5% Purification threshold, leading to no purification requirement. However, the overall classification for NVIDIA is Non-Compliant. Portfolio managers are advised that the company is an allowed holding with approximately 1.3% purification of dividends/earnings recommended.

Company Overview

NVIDIA Corporation is a leading multinational technology company specializing in the design and manufacturing of semiconductors and graphics processing units (GPUs). It serves a broad range of industries including gaming, data centers, and artificial intelligence. The company’s products enable high-performance computing and visualization across various sectors.

  • GPU and AI hardware development
  • High-performance computing solutions
  • Software and platform services
  • Enterprise and cloud infrastructure support
  • General-purpose technology deployed globally

Quantitative Shariah Screening

Financial Metric Value Shariah Threshold Compliance Status
Debt Ratio 0.23% 33.00% Pass
Cash and Marketable Securities Ratio 1.06% 33.00% Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio 1.37% 5.00% Pass

Note: Despite passing quantitative financial thresholds, NLP (Non-Permissible Income) detailed analysis leads to a non-compliant screening outcome due to sector exposures.

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Haram Revenue: Approx. 1.3% of total revenue (range 0.79% to 1.81%)

Key Haram Components: Interest and dividend income (riba) from cash and marketable securities (~0.9%), gambling-related commissions from App Store (~0.3%), advertising revenue from gambling/simulated gambling advertisers (~0.1%).

Haram Revenue Composition

Item / Line Point % of Total Revenue Range (Lower–Upper) Why Non-Permissible Reference IDs
Interest and dividend income on marketable securities portfolio 0.7% 0.45% – 0.9% Riba income from debt/equity securities held for investment AAPL_10K_2023_OIE_Breakout, AAPL_10K_2025_MarketRisk, AAPL_10K_2025_OIE_Total
Interest income on cash and cash equivalents 0.2% 0.15% – 0.3% Riba income from bank deposits and money market instruments AAPL_10K_2023_OIE_Breakout, AAPL_10K_2025_MarketRisk
Commissions on social casino in-app purchases (slots/poker/bingo on iOS) 0.3% 0.15% – 0.45% Facilitates and earns from games of chance (maysir) via in-app purchase commissions on casino-style apps AAPL_10K_2025_AppStore_NetRecognition, SocialCasino_GVR_2025, SimCasino_Litigation_Reuters_2025, SensorTower_StateOfMobile_2025, Statista_iOS_Casino_Publishers_2025
Apple Ads – real-money gambling advertisers (sports betting, casino, fantasy) 0.04% 0.01% – 0.06% Paid promotion of real-money gambling services AppleAdsPolicy_2025, ExchangeWire_AppleAds_6to8B, ASA_MoreAds_2025
Apple Ads – simulated gambling app advertisers 0.02% 0.01% – 0.04% Paid promotion of games of chance (simulated casino) considered maysir-like AppleAdsPolicy_2025, ExchangeWire_AppleAds_6to8B

Composition detail: No other haram revenue composition items provided.

References

  1. AAPL_10K_2023_OIE_Breakout (filing, 2023-11-03) — Baseline magnitude of Apple’s interest/dividend income to inform FY2025 estimate as % of revenue — Link
  2. AAPL_10K_2025_OIE_Total (filing, 2025-11-01) — Confirms Other income/(expense) exists and can be volatile; interest income not separately disclosed for FY2025 — Link
  3. AAPL_10K_2025_MarketRisk (filing, 2025-11-01) — Substantiates large interest-sensitive asset base and interest expense; supports extrapolating recurring interest income — Link
  4. AAPL_10K_2025_AppStore_NetRecognition (filing, 2025-11-01) — Apple books only commissions from third-party App Store sales as Services revenue, so commissions from gambling-like apps flow into Apple’s revenue — Link
  5. SocialCasino_GVR_2025 (third_party_estimate, 2025-10-16) — Orders of magnitude for global social casino spending used to size Apple’s commission slice — Link
  6. SimCasino_Litigation_Reuters_2025 (third_party_estimate, 2025-09-30) — Evidence that Apple collects commissions tied to casino-style apps on its platform — Link
  7. SensorTower_StateOfMobile_2025 (third_party_estimate, 2025-03-11) — Context for total IAP market size to anchor category allocation assumptions — Link
  8. Statista_iOS_Casino_Publishers_2025 (third_party_estimate, 2025-07-01) — Corroborates significant recurring iOS in-app purchase revenue in the casino category — Link
  9. AppleAdsPolicy_2025 (filing, 2025-02-26) — Confirms Apple sells ads to gambling and simulated gambling categories in eligible placements — Link
  10. ExchangeWire_AppleAds_6to8B (third_party_estimate, 2025-08-28) — Order-of-magnitude for Apple Ads revenue used to size gambling share — Link
  11. ASA_MoreAds_2025 (third_party_estimate, 2025-12-18) — Indicates expansion of search ad inventory supporting presence and growth of Apple Ads — Link

Final Shariah Verdict

Screening Status: FAIL

Final Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Non-Permissible Income Estimate: Approximately 1.3% of total revenue (range 0.79% to 1.81%).

Purification Recommendation: Not required under current screening rules (NPIN below 5%).

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Exposure to riba through interest and dividend income on cash and marketable securities.
  • Non-permissible earnings from facilitation and commission on gambling and simulated gambling apps in Apple's App Store.
  • Advertising revenue from gambling-related advertisers, both real-money and simulated gambling.
  • Dual-use technology caution: NVIDIA’s AI and semiconductor products are general-purpose but sold to sovereign/government customers, necessitating caution though not constituting a core Shariah fail.
  • NPIN levels below 5% threshold limit purification requirements but still result in non-compliance on screening.
  • Consistent with Shariah principles to avoid assisting sin and transgression (ta’awun ‘ala al-ithm) and doubtful matters due to limited disclosure.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

NVIDIA Corporation is currently a non-compliant holding under Shariah screening due to its exposure to riba and indirect involvement with gambling-related activities via App Store commissions and advertising. The company’s NPIN is approximately 1.3%, which is below the 5% purification threshold; hence, no purification is strictly required. However, purification of dividends or distributable income by the stated NPIN percentage (~1.37%) is recommended as prudent compliance practice.

Portfolio managers should be aware of the dual-use rating caution due to sales of general-purpose AI hardware to government customers but note that this is not deemed a core breach. Holding NVIDIA must be monitored periodically for any change in risk exposures. Engagement with the company or close monitoring of reporting disclosures on financial income and segment activities is advisable.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Apple Inc. (AAPL) - Shariah Compliance Report

1. Executive Summary

Apple Inc. (Ticker: AAPL) has undergone comprehensive Shariah compliance screening for the reporting period ending October 30, 2025. The overall Shariah verdict is COMPLIANT WITH PURIFICATION with a screening status of PASS WITH PURIFICATION. The non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio reported is 0.04% of revenue, with a recommended purification ratio also at 0.04% of distributable income. The estimated non-compliant or haram sector share of revenue is approximately 1.5%, within a range of 1.0% to 2.1%. Key haram income drivers include interest-based treasury and finance income (~1.3% of revenue) and advertising services promoting non-permissible categories (~0.2% of revenue). Debt and liquidity ratios are well within acceptable limits.

2. Company Overview

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: October 30, 2025

Company Description: Apple Inc. is a leading multinational technology company specializing in the design, manufacture, and marketing of consumer electronics, software, and services. Its flagship products include smartphones, personal computers, tablets, and digital media devices. The company is widely recognized for its innovation in hardware and software integration. Apple also operates digital content stores and offers various subscription-based services.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Consumer electronics manufacturing and sales
  • Software and operating system development
  • Digital content distribution and subscription services
  • Advertising services
  • Cloud and enterprise service offerings

3. Quantitative Shariah Screening

Screening Metric Value Shariah Threshold Status
Debt Ratio 2.4% ≤ 33% PASS
Cash and Investments Ratio 3.22% ≤ 33% PASS
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio 0.04% ≤ 5% PASS

The company maintains very low leverage and liquidity holdings well within Shariah-compliant thresholds. NPIN is negligible relative to revenue.

4. Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Haram Revenue Share: ≈ 1.5% (range 1.0% – 2.15%)

Key contributors to the haram revenue share are interest-based income from treasury and finance activities, and revenues from advertising services linked to non-permissible categories:

Haram Revenue Composition

Item / Line Point % of Total Revenue Range (Lower–Upper) Why Non-Permissible Reference IDs
Interest on marketable debt securities (U.S. Treasuries, corporate and other fixed-income holdings) 0.85% 0.55% – 1.10% Coupon/interest receipts from conventional fixed‑income instruments are riba. SEC_2024_Q3_10Q, SEC_2024_10K, IR_Q3_2025_BS
Interest on cash and cash equivalents (bank deposits, money market instruments) 0.45% 0.40% – 0.60% Yield on cash-like instruments and bank deposits is conventional interest (riba). SEC_2024_Q3_10Q, SEC_2024_10K, IR_Q3_2025_BS
Gambling operators and services (online sportsbooks, casinos, DFS) – Search/YouTube/Network ads 0.08% 0.02% – 0.20% Promotion and facilitation of gambling services are non‑permissible. Alphabet’s ad sales to these advertisers are its own service revenues. GOOGLE_ADS_GAMBLING_POLICY, YOUTUBE_MASTHEAD_RESTRICTION, AGA_2024_SPORTS_BETTING_ADS, MEDIARADAR_GAMBLING_2024
Alcohol brands – Search/YouTube/Network ads 0.12% 0.03% – 0.25% Promotion of alcohol is non‑permissible; Alphabet earns ad revenue from these campaigns, albeit with policy restrictions and user controls. GOOGLE_ADS_ALCOHOL_CONTROLS, YOUTUBE_MASTHEAD_RESTRICTION

References

  1. [SEC_2024_Q3_10Q] Alphabet Inc. Form 10-Q (Quarter ended Sep 30, 2024) – OI&E components with interest income (filing, 2024-09-30) — Existence and magnitude of interest income line item used to scale NPIN as % of total revenue. Link
  2. [SEC_2024_10K] Alphabet Inc. Form 10-K (FY ended Dec 31, 2024) – Consolidated revenues and OI&E context (filing, 2024-12-31) — Total FY2024 revenue base ($350.0bn) used as denominator; OI&E context for interest income. Link
  3. [IR_Q3_2025_BS] Alphabet Investor Relations – Q3 2025 press/Earnings materials (cash and marketable securities) (third_party_estimate, 2025-09-30) — Balance of cash and marketable securities (~$98.5bn) indicating ongoing interest-generating base. Link
  4. [GOOGLE_ADS_GAMBLING_POLICY] Google Ads – Gambling and games policy (certification, country restrictions) (third_party_estimate, 2025-11-19) — Alphabet permits gambling ads (with restrictions), confirming direct monetization of this category. Link
  5. [YOUTUBE_MASTHEAD_RESTRICTION] Coverage of YouTube masthead prohibitions (gambling, alcohol, politics, prescription drugs) (third_party_estimate, 2021-06-15) — Policy constraints that limit—but do not eliminate—alcohol/gambling ad monetization. Link
  6. [AGA_2024_SPORTS_BETTING_ADS] American Gaming Association (Nielsen study) – 2024 sports betting advertising trends (third_party_estimate, 2024-12-20) — Small relative share/volume of sports betting advertising in the U.S., informing a conservative % of Alphabet revenue. Link
  7. [MEDIARADAR_GAMBLING_2024] MediaRadar – Q4 2023/2024 gambling & casinos advertisers and channel mix (third_party_estimate, 2024-12-01) — Gambling advertisers’ spend levels and limited digital share, supporting a small contribution to Alphabet. Link
  8. [GOOGLE_ADS_ALCOHOL_CONTROLS] Google blog – User controls to see fewer alcohol and gambling ads (third_party_estimate, 2020-12-10) — Alphabet’s continued allowance of alcohol/gambling ads with added user controls; indicates monetization exists with constraints. Link

5. Final Shariah Verdict

Apple Inc. is classified as COMPLIANT WITH PURIFICATION. The company's business activities are predominantly permissible with incidental non-permissible income related primarily to treasury interest income and limited advertising revenue from non-permissible sectors such as alcohol and gambling. The total haram revenue is estimated at approximately 1.5%, which is below the 5% threshold. Purification of dividends and earnings at the recommended rate of approximately 1.5% is required.

6. Key Shariah Considerations

  • Interest-based income arises from conventional fixed-income securities and banking deposits held in treasury portfolios, constituting the dominant haram exposure.
  • Advertising revenue includes a small portion related to non-permissible sectors, primarily controlled and restricted through platform policies.
  • The company’s primary business is neutral/dual-use consumer technology and services; thus, non-permissible exposures are incidental.
  • Debt and liquidity levels are well within Shariah-compliant limits, supporting financial soundness.
  • The company does not hold preferred or trust shares that would affect compliance status.
  • Screening incorporates a cautious approach due to indirect exposures via clients in conventional finance and estimated interest income.
  • Purification is mandatory given the presence of non-permissible income, with a clear method recommended for dividend purifications.

7. Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Apple Inc. is an approved holding for Islamic portfolios under the current screening results. Managers should apply the recommended purification of approximately 1.5% on dividends and earnings before distribution to investors. The company’s exposure to non-permissible income is low and stable, reflecting no immediate red flags for Shariah compliance. Continuing monitoring is advised with attention to potential changes in interest income and advertising policy enforcement related to non-permissible sectors.

Portfolio managers should note the PASS WITH PURIFICATION status and ensure shareholders understand the need for purification. No board review is required at present. The company’s activities remain substantially Shariah-compliant, with incidental non-compliant revenues appropriately managed.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL)

1. Header Snapshot

  • Ticker: GOOGL
  • Company Name: Alphabet Inc.
  • Report Date: 2025-10-29
  • Sector: Internet Content & Information
  • Security Type: CAP STK CL A
  • Screening Status: FAIL
  • Final Shariah Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

2. Executive Summary

The overall Shariah verdict for Alphabet Inc. is NON_COMPLIANT, with a screening status of FAIL. The reported non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio stands at 1.28% of total revenue, while the estimated haram-sector share of revenue is approximately 1.0% (ranging from 0.9% to 1.2%). The main contributors to non-permissible income are interest and dividend income from non-operating activities, which account for about 0.9% of total revenue, and a small portion of advertising revenue (around 0.1%) derived from prohibited categories, particularly related to Microsoft Advertising/Xandr operations. Although these exposures fall below the 5% NPIN threshold, the company is classified as non-compliant, and a purification ratio of 1.28% is applied to distributable income. The debt ratio is low at 0.68%, and cash & investment ratios are within acceptable limits at 3.54%.

3. Company Overview

Alphabet Inc. is a global technology conglomerate primarily focused on internet-related services and products. It operates a wide range of businesses including online advertising technologies, search engines, cloud computing, software, and hardware products. The company is recognized for its innovation and leadership in digital platforms and data-driven technologies.

  • Search engine and online advertising
  • Cloud computing and enterprise software
  • Hardware products
  • Artificial intelligence and machine learning
  • Content platforms and information services

4. Quantitative Shariah Screening

Ratio Percentage Threshold Compliance
Debt Ratio 0.68% ≤ 33% Pass
Cash and Investments Ratio 3.54% ≤ 33% Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio 1.28% ≤ 5% Pass (Below threshold but screening status: FAIL)

5. Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Haram Revenue Share: ≈ 1.0% (range 0.9%–1.2%)

Key Non-Permissible Segments: Interest and dividends income (non-operating) (~0.9% of revenue), Advertising sold into prohibited categories (Microsoft Advertising/Xandr) (~0.1% of revenue)

Haram Revenue Composition

Item / Line Point % of Total Revenue Range (Lower–Upper) Why Non-Permissible Reference IDs

Dividends and similar portfolio income (aggregated with interest in filings) 0.14% 0.1% – 0.2% Conservatively treated as non-permissible due to aggregation with interest and potential dividends from non-compliant instruments; exact split not disclosed. MSFT_FY25_10K_OIE, MSFT_IR_FY25_IncomeStmt

MSFT_Ads_AdultProgram_Form, MSFT_IR_FY25_MPC_Performance, MSFT_10K_FY24_RevenueByProduct

References

  1. [MSFT_FY25_10K_OIE] Microsoft Form 10-K FY2025 – Note: Other income (expense), net (shows Interest and dividends income $2,647m) (filing, as of 2025-06-30) — Quantifies riba-based income line used to compute NPIN as a % of total revenue.
    Link
  2. [MSFT_IR_FY25_IncomeStmt] Microsoft Investor Relations – FY25 Q4 Income Statements (annual totals) (filing, as of 2025-06-30) — Total FY2025 revenue $281,724m denominator for NPIN ratio.
    Link
  3. [MSFT_10Q_Investments_Mar2025] Microsoft Form 10-Q (quarter ended March 31, 2025) – Cash, Cash Equivalents, and Investments (filing, as of 2025-03-31) — Portfolio composition predominantly highly liquid investment-grade fixed-income securities that earn interest.
    Link
  4. [MSFT_Ads_GamblingPolicy_Form] Microsoft Advertising – Gambling and Contests Advertising Program (approval required; market-by-market) (industry knowledge, as of 2025-12-26) — Confirms Microsoft accepts gambling ads in approved markets; underpins presence of non-permissible ad revenue.
    Link
  5. [MSFT_Ads_AdultProgram_Form] Microsoft Advertising – Adult Advertising Program participation form and guidelines (industry knowledge, as_of 2025-12-26) — Confirms Microsoft accepts certain adult category ads in specified markets; supports inclusion of a small NPIN component.
    Link
  6. [MSFT_Ads_Policy_Update_Blog] Microsoft Advertising blog – Updates to our network policies (notes gambling allowed on Microsoft Audience Network in allowed markets) (industry knowledge, as_of 2023-06-01) — Policy confirmation that gambling ads are permitted on parts of Microsoft’s ad network.
    Link
  7. [MSFT_IR_FY25_MPC_Performance] Microsoft Investor Relations – FY25 Q4 More Personal Computing Performance (filing, as_of 2025-06-30) — Scale context: Search and news advertising revenue increased $1.6bn (+13%) in FY2025, used to bound category share assumptions.
    Link
  8. [MSFT_10K_FY24_RevenueByProduct] Microsoft Form 10-K FY2024 – Revenue by significant product and service offerings (Search and news advertising $12,576m) (filing, as_of 2024-06-30) — Baseline size of Search and news advertising to scale the non-permissible ad categories.
    Link

6. Final Shariah Verdict

The company is classified as NON_COMPLIANT under Shariah screening despite its NPIN being below the 5% threshold. The non-compliance arises primarily from riba-based income through interest and dividends, and to a minor extent from advertising revenues associated with prohibited categories such as gambling and adult content. Purification of distributable income at 1.28% is recommended. Debt and cash & investment ratios are within acceptable Shariah limits.

7. Key Shariah Considerations

  • The NPIN ratio (1.28%) is below the 5% maximum threshold but above the stricter internal threshold applied, leading to non-compliance status.
  • Interest and dividends income is treated conservatively as fully non-permissible due to aggregation and lack of detailed portfolio split.
  • Advertisement revenue generated from prohibited categories (gambling, adult content) is minimal but factored into the NPIN calculation.
  • Company operations include dual-use technologies providing neutral infrastructure; exposure arises mainly from treasury and minor advertising segments.
  • Purification of dividend and earnings distribution is necessary to cleanse impermissible income portions.
  • Debt level (0.68%) and cash/investments ratio (3.54%) comply with Shariah standards.

8. Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Alphabet Inc. is an allowed holding with a recommendation for purification of approximately 1.28% of dividends or distributable earnings attributable to non-permissible income sources. Portfolio managers should monitor the company’s treasury income mix and advertising policies continuously, especially given the small but present exposure to prohibited categories in advertising. Maintaining scrutiny on updated financial disclosures is advisable to ensure ongoing compliance and proper calculation of purification. The current non-compliant revenue share is relatively low and supports continued investment with appropriate purification mechanisms in place.

haram_global_reasoning: Amazon reports about ~$5.2–$5.6B per quarter of Physical Stores revenue (Whole Foods Market and other owned stores), implying roughly ~$22B annualized vs. ~$638B total company revenue. Whole Foods prominently sells beer and wine (and spirits where permitted), and Amazon Fresh/Prime Now offers beer and wine delivery in select areas. Because Amazon does not disclose category revenue for alcohol, we apply industry knowledge for supermarkets’ alcohol mix (mid‑single digits of store sales for beer/wine; lower spirits penetration, varying by state). Applying an estimated 4–9% alcohol mix to ~3.4% of Amazon’s total revenue that comes from Physical Stores, and adding a small allowance for online alcohol delivery (state‑limited), yields ~0.30% of total Amazon revenue from clearly non‑permissible alcohol sales (range ~0.15%–0.45%). This is well below the 5% NPIN rule.
haram_limitations: Amazon does not break out category sales (e.g., alcohol) within Physical Stores or Online Stores. Spirits availability varies by jurisdiction; online alcohol delivery coverage is patchy and changes over time. The split among beer vs. wine vs. spirits is not disclosed; product‑level estimates rely on supermarket category norms and Whole Foods’ merchandising emphasis, labeled as industry_knowledge. Estimates exclude any indirect/dual‑use revenue (e.g., AWS serving alcohol companies) and exclude non‑operating items.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT)

1. Header Snapshot

Company Name Microsoft Corporation
Ticker MSFT
Sector Software - Infrastructure
Type of Security Common Stock (COM)
Screening Status FAIL
Final Shariah Classification NON_COMPLIANT
Report Date 2025-10-29
Debt Ratio (%) 1.69
Cash & Investments Ratio (%) 3.06
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio (%) 1.39
Purification Ratio Applied (%) 1.39
Estimated Haram Sector Revenue (%) ≈ 0.4% (range 0.2%–0.6%)

2. Executive Summary

Microsoft Corporation has been rated as NON_COMPLIANT in this Shariah compliance screening for the period ending 2025-10-29. The company’s Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) stands at 1.39% of total revenue, triggering a fail in screening despite the overall low level of haram sector revenue estimated at approximately 0.4% (range from 0.2% to 0.6%).

The primary sources of non-permissible income relate to retail sales of alcoholic beverages (~0.3%) and pork products (~0.1%) through owned grocery operations. Additionally, Microsoft has generated interest income from its financial activities, which also contributes to the NPIN. The debt and cash ratios remain well within acceptable limits. Purification of dividends at 1.39% is recommended where applicable.

3. Company Overview

Exchange: N/A

Country: N/A

Reporting Period: 2025-10-29

Company Description: Microsoft Corporation is a global leader in software and technology, specializing in infrastructure software solutions. The company offers a broad range of products including cloud computing services, operating systems, productivity software, and developer tools. Microsoft supports enterprises, governments, and consumers worldwide with scalable and innovative technological platforms.

Business Segments Summary:

  • Cloud services and AI infrastructure
  • Software products and platforms
  • Business productivity applications
  • Gaming and consumer electronics
  • Technology consulting and services

4. Quantitative Shariah Screening

Debt Ratio (%) 1.69
Cash & Investments Ratio (%) 3.06
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio (%) 1.39
Purification Ratio (%) 1.39
Screening Status FAIL

The company meets acceptable thresholds for debt and cash ratios, but fails the overall Shariah screening due to NPIN exceeding the implicit threshold. Purification of dividends to the level of NPIN is recommended.

5. Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Haram Revenue: ≈ 0.4% (range 0.2%–0.6%) of total revenue.

Haram Revenue Composition

Pork products retail sales (Whole Foods Market and Amazon Fresh) ~0.08% 0.05% – 0.12% Retail sale of pork products (fresh cuts and processed meats). WFM_Meat_QS, WFM_Meat_Dept, duBreton_Pork_PR, Industry_Pork_Mix

Haram Segments Detail

  • Alcoholic Beverages Retail Sales: Involves revenue from beer, wine, and spirits sales predominantly through Whole Foods Market physical stores and Amazon Fresh/Prime Now grocery delivery in jurisdictions allowing spirits sales. Estimated to represent ~0.3% of total revenue. The company excludes any dual-use infrastructure revenues related to AWS or logistics.
  • Pork Products Retail Sales: Revenue from fresh and processed pork products offered across Whole Foods Market and Amazon Fresh grocery channels, estimated at ~0.08% of total revenue.

Note: These haram-related retail activities are a small fraction of total company revenue and are clearly segregated from its core software and infrastructure business, which is dual-use and permissible.

6. Final Shariah Verdict

Classification: NON_COMPLIANT
Microsoft Corporation has failed the Shariah compliance screening on account of non-permissible income from minor alcohol and pork retail sales as well as interest income from financial activities.
The non-permissible income ratio stands at 1.39%, with haram sector revenue estimated at approximately 0.38% of total revenue. The company’s core business remains Shariah compliant and is considered dual-use infrastructure software.

7. Key Shariah Considerations

  • Purification is recommended on dividends and earnings equivalent to the NPIN ratio (1.39%).
  • Alcoholic beverage sales occur via owned grocery retail operations, representing ~0.3% of revenue. This is clearly non-permissible due to the khamr (wine/beer/spirits) content.
  • Pork product retail sales contribute roughly 0.1% of revenue and are non-permissible.
  • Interest income is present due to financial income, requiring purification though it is non-core to the main operating business.
  • Core software and infrastructure operations are permissible and dual-use; haram activities are segregated to grocery retail categories.
  • The company’s debt and cash levels are low and within acceptable Shariah limits.
  • Risk flags include the presence of clients in the conventional banking sector and minor interest income exposure.

8. Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Microsoft Corporation is an allowed holding with some caution due to its minor NPIN and haram sector exposures. Purification at approximately 0.38% (reflecting the point estimate of haram revenue) or 1.39% (NPIN ratio) is advised on dividends and earnings distributed.
Portfolio managers should monitor the evolving composition of retail food revenue, especially in alcohol and pork, as well as interest income disclosures. Continued exclusion of dual-use infrastructure revenues from haram calculations is important.
Due to the small scale of non-permissible activities and overall Shariah compliance of core operations, the company remains investable within Shariah-constrained portfolios subject to purification.
No board review is required at this time.

haram_global_reasoning: Business model: Meta is an advertising-led internet platform; its own products and services are not inherently non-permissible. The clearly haram component is riba-based income from interest-bearing holdings. Measurement basis: As of Q3 2025 (report date Oct 29, 2025), Meta’s Form 10-Q discloses Nine Months Ended Sep 30, 2025 interest and other income breakdown: interest income $1,498m; interest expense $(709)m; FX gains $470m; other income $788m (primarily unrealized gains on marketable equity securities). Total revenue for the same nine-month period was $141,073m. Treating only interest income as non-permissible yields ~$1,498m / $141,073m ≈ 1.06% of total revenue. We set a 0.9–1.3% range to reflect quarter-to-quarter variability and potential year-end mix. Cross-check: FY2024 reported interest and other income, net was $1,283m on $164,501m revenue (0.78% on a net basis), while Q1 2025 showed $827m net on $42,314m revenue; however, Q3 2025 notes clarify that large portions of 'other income' were unrealized equity gains, which are excluded from haram. Conclusion vs 5% NPIN rule: total haram is well below 5%.
haram_limitations: Instrument-level interest income split (e.g., money market vs. U.S. Treasuries vs. corporate debt) is not disclosed; we infer composition from year-end 2024 portfolio mix, which may have shifted in 2025. Dividends embedded in 'other income' are not broken out; any non-compliant share of such dividends is expected to be immaterial relative to revenue. Our percent-of-revenue uses 9M 2025 revenue as the denominator given the Oct 29, 2025 report date; full-year 2025 could differ modestly.

Shariah Compliance Report Snapshot – Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN)

  • Exchange: NASDAQ
  • Country: United States
  • Sector: Specialty Retail
  • Reporting Period: October 30, 2025
  • Screening Status: FAIL
  • Final Shariah Verdict: NON_COMPLIANT
  • Debt Ratio: 5.32%
  • Cash + Investments Ratio: 4.11%
  • Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio: 0.73%
  • Estimated Haram Revenue (% of total): ≈ 1.1% (Range: 0.9%–1.3%)

Executive Summary

Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) was evaluated for its Shariah compliance status as of its 2025 reporting period. The company currently reports a non-permissible income (NPIN) ratio of 0.73%, which is below the 5% threshold. However, detailed segment analysis estimates approximately 1.1% of total revenue arises from haram sources, specifically non-operating interest and investment income (riba). Although this is a relatively low percentage, it exceeds certain Shariah screening criteria, resulting in a NON_COMPLIANT final verdict and an overall fail on the screening status.

There are no concerns relating to debt and cash investment ratios, both comfortably within acceptable limits. Dual-use cautions arise from Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud infrastructure being sold to government and commercial sectors, but these do not constitute core military or defense revenue and are noted as cautions rather than disqualifiers.

No purification is deemed required for investors, given the NPIN ratio, inferring a manageable level of impermissible income in the company's earnings distribution.

Company Overview

Amazon.com, Inc. is a global e-commerce and technology leader specializing in a wide range of products and services. It operates primarily through online retail platforms, cloud computing services, and digital content distribution. The company is known for its expansive logistics network, AWS cloud infrastructure, and diverse consumer offerings.

  • E-commerce Retail and Marketplace Operations
  • Cloud Services via AWS (including AI infrastructure)
  • Subscription Services and Digital Content
  • Logistics and Delivery Services
  • Technology Solutions for Enterprises and Governments

Quantitative Shariah Screening

MetricValueShariah ThresholdCompliance Status
Debt Ratio5.32%≤ 33%Pass
Cash + Investments Ratio4.11%≤ 33%Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio0.73%≤ 5%Pass

Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Estimated Haram Revenue: Approximately 1.1% of total revenue (range from 0.9% to 1.3%) due to riba-based income.

Main Haram Segment: Non-operating interest and investment income (riba) derived from interest-bearing cash, cash equivalents, and marketable debt securities.

Haram Revenue Composition

Interest on cash equivalents and bank/time deposits (incl. money market funds) 0.6% 0.4% – 0.7% Riba from interest-bearing deposits and cash equivalents (e.g., money market funds and time deposits). ref_q3_2025_10q_interest_breakdown, ref_fy2024_10k_fairvalue_mix
Interest on marketable debt securities (U.S. government/agency and investment-grade corporate bonds) 0.5% 0.3% – 0.6% Riba from coupon income on interest-bearing debt securities held in the treasury portfolio. ref_q3_2025_10q_interest_breakdown, ref_fy2024_10k_fairvalue_mix

References

  1. [ref_q3_2025_10q_interest_breakdown] Meta Platforms, Inc. Form 10-Q (Quarter ended Sep 30, 2025) – Interest and other income breakdown table (filing, as of 2025-10-30) — Amounts for interest income ($1,498m YTD), exclusion of unrealized equity gains from haram classification, and 9M 2025 total revenue ($141,073m).
    URL
  2. [ref_fy2024_10k_fairvalue_mix] Meta Form 10-K for year ended Dec 31, 2024 – Liquidity and investments, fair value tables (filing, as of 2025-01-30) — Portfolio composition (money market funds, U.S. government/agency, corporate debt, marketable equity securities) used to infer interest-income mix.
    URL

Final Shariah Verdict

Classification: NON_COMPLIANT

Rationale: While Amazon’s debt and NPIN ratios fall within acceptable bounds, the total share of haram revenue exceeds internal conservative screening thresholds, driven by interest income from non-operating financial assets. Additionally, dual-use caution is noted owing to AWS services sold to government customers, posing potential risk areas.

Investors should consider this non-compliance when making portfolio decisions, though no purification is required due to NPIN being below the 5% cutoff.

Key Shariah Considerations

  • Primary source of impermissible income is riba-based interest from cash equivalents and debt securities.
  • Debt ratio and cash+investment holdings remain low and well within acceptable thresholds.
  • Dual-use caution flagged for cloud infrastructure offerings that serve both commercial and government sectors, including possible defense-related uses, but do not directly generate haram revenue.
  • No direct involvement in sectors explicitly forbidden in Shariah.
  • The company does not require purification via dividend cleansing given the NPIN ratio below 5%.
  • Regulatory filings and detailed financial disclosures form the basis of screening and estimate calculations.

Guidance for Portfolio Managers

Amazon.com, Inc. is classified as a NON_COMPLIANT holding due primarily to its minor but measurable income from non-operating interest sources. Given its NPIN ratio of 0.73%, below the 5% threshold, the company remains a potential holding with recommended purification of approximately 1.1% against dividends or distributable income to cleanse impermissible earnings.

This holding should be monitored for any shifts in financial composition, especially changes in interest income or further regulatory updates. Portfolio managers should note the dual-use nature of AWS services and apply appropriate caution but not treat this as a disqualifier, as these are general-purpose infrastructure products.

Overall, Amazon can be maintained in portfolios with the appropriate purification process applied and ongoing Shariah supervision to address any material changes to its financial profile.

shariah_memo_markdown:
Shariah Compliance Report: Meta Platforms, Inc. (META)

1. Header Snapshot

  • Company: Meta Platforms, Inc.
  • Ticker: META
  • Type of Security: CL A
  • Sector: Internet Content & Information
  • Exchange: NASDAQ
  • Country: United States
  • Reporting Date: 2025-10-29
  • Screening Status: PASS WITH PURIFICATION
  • Final Shariah Verdict: COMPLIANT WITH PURIFICATION

2. Executive Summary

Meta Platforms, Inc. passes Shariah compliance screening with a verdict of Compliant with Purification. The company’s reported Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) ratio stands at 1.53%, which is below the 5% threshold. Purification is recommended at 1.53% of distributable income to cleanse earnings derived from non-permissible activities.

The primary source of non-permissible income is linked to conventional vehicle insurance through Tesla Insurance subsidiaries, estimated at approximately 1.0% of total revenue with a range between 0.6% and 1.4%. Other financial ratios, such as debt and cash/investment levels, comfortably comply with Shariah limits.

No critical Shariah issues were identified, though one quality assurance flag relating to reporting detail was noted and does not materially impact the compliance status.

3. Company Overview

Meta Platforms, Inc. is a leading technology company engaged primarily in the development and operation of social media platforms, digital advertising, and various AI-powered services. The company’s core business encompasses digital content delivery, social networking, and related software solutions designed to connect and engage users globally. Meta also explores ancillary services supporting its main platforms.

  • Social media and digital advertising
  • Artificial intelligence and machine learning integration
  • Augmented and virtual reality applications
  • Software and platform services
  • Consumer engagement tools

4. Quantitative Shariah Screening

Cash & Investments Ratio 5.10% ≤ 33.00% Pass
Non-Permissible Income (NPIN) Ratio 1.53% ≤ 5.00% Pass (with purification)

5. Non-Permissible Income & Haram Sector Assessment

Total Estimated Haram Revenue: ≈ 1.0% (range 0.6%–1.4%) of total revenue
